Sentencas: Reversible solid oxide cell technology (RSOC) is a key technology in future hydrogen energy concept and may play a significant role in stabilizing intermittent renewable electric power sources.
Titulo: Influence of Hydrogen Electrode Active Layer Thickness on Electrochemical Performance of Solid Oxide Cell Operating in Electrolysis Mode

Sentencas: This work handles an attempt to optimize the thickness of the hydrogen electrode active layer (HEAL) for solid oxide cells designed and developed initially for fuel cell application (SOFC).
Titulo: Influence of Hydrogen Electrode Active Layer Thickness on Electrochemical Performance of Solid Oxide Cell Operating in Electrolysis Mode

Sentencas: Five cells with HEAL thickness of 0, 7, 12, 16 and 20 & mu;m, prepared using industrial manufacturing methods, are analyzed using cyclic voltammetry (CV) and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) methods under a wide range of operating conditions.
Titulo: Influence of Hydrogen Electrode Active Layer Thickness on Electrochemical Performance of Solid Oxide Cell Operating in Electrolysis Mode

Sentencas: Optimal thickness of an active layer studied depends on operating conditions.
Titulo: Influence of Hydrogen Electrode Active Layer Thickness on Electrochemical Performance of Solid Oxide Cell Operating in Electrolysis Mode

Sentencas: Depending on the temperature and feed gas water content applied highest performances were achieved for cells with HEAL thicknesses between 7 and 16 & mu;m.
Titulo: Influence of Hydrogen Electrode Active Layer Thickness on Electrochemical Performance of Solid Oxide Cell Operating in Electrolysis Mode

Sentencas: At 800 & DEG;C and 90% feed gas water content, the best cell had an active layer of 7 & mu;m, drawing -3.5
Titulo: Influence of Hydrogen Electrode Active Layer Thickness on Electrochemical Performance of Solid Oxide Cell Operating in Electrolysis Mode
